indication: Chronic kidney disease stage 3b, evaluate differential renal function and drainage
technique: Following IV injection of Tc-99m MAG3, serial images of the kidneys were obtained. Furosemide 40 mg IV was administered at 20 minutes.

findings.drainage: Mildly delayed washout bilaterally, improved with furosemide. No high-grade obstruction.
findings.bladder: Normal radiotracer accumulation in the bladder.
findings.background: Increased background activity consistent with impaired renal function.
findings.gfr: Calculated GFR by Gates method: 38 mL/min/1.73m2

impression: Bilaterally small kidneys with reduced cortical uptake consistent with chronic kidney disease.
Calculated GFR 38 mL/min/1.73m2, consistent with CKD stage 3b.
No high-grade obstruction. Mildly delayed drainage improved with furosemide.
Findings correlate with known chronic kidney disease.
comparison: No prior renal scan available for comparison. Renal ultrasound dated 2021-06-15 showed small bilateral kidneys.
